intro: Knautia ceretana var. tenuiloba, commonly known as the slender knautia, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wildflower meadows.
